Package org.forgerock.openidm.jetty

Class JettyErrorHandler

java.lang.Object
org.eclipse.jetty.ee10.servlet.ErrorHandler
org.forgerock.openidm.jetty.JettyErrorHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.jetty.server.Request.Handler, org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.Invocable
public class JettyErrorHandler extends org.eclipse.jetty.ee10.servlet.ErrorHandler
Custom org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ErrorHandler implementation that removes sensitive information from HTTP error-responses.

  • Method Details

    • handle

      public boolean handle(org.eclipse.jetty.server.Request request, org.eclipse.jetty.server.Response response, org.eclipse.jetty.util.Callback callback) throws Exception
      Handles Jetty errors originating from HTTP requests. Add the following entry to jetty.xml or directly to an org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server instance. 

       <Configure id="Server" class="org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server">
   ...
   <Call name="addBean">
     <Arg>
       <New class="org.forgerock.openidm.jetty.JettyErrorHandler"/>
     </Arg>
   </Call>
   ...
 </Configure>
      Specified by:
      handle in interface org.eclipse.jetty.server.Request.Handler
      Overrides:
      handle in class org.eclipse.jetty.ee10.servlet.ErrorHandler
      Parameters:
      target - The target of the request, which is either a URI, name, or null.
      baseRequest - Jetty HTTP request
      request - Servlet HTTP request
      response - Servlet HTTP response
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O error
      Exception

    • outputErrorPageResponse

      public static void outputErrorPageResponse(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException
      Outputs an error page, corresponding to pages stored in the ui/errors/ directory within OpenIDM's root directory. Status codes map to HTML file-names, or to the default HTML page.

      For example,

      • ui/errors/404.html
      • ui/errors/default.html
      Parameters:
      request - Servlet HTTP request
      response - Servlet HTTP response
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O error
